#Text=Phoenix
#Text=Phoenix is the capital of the state of Arizona as well as the most populous city in the American Southwest and sixth largest city in the United States .
#Text=Founded in 1871 , it has become the region 's primary political , cultural , economic , and transportation center .
#Text=At an elevation of 1100 ft ( 335 m ) , it is situated in the biologically unique Sonoran Desert .
#Text=Over time it has merged with the neighboring cities of Scottsdale , Tempe , Glendale , Peoria , Chandler , and Gilbert to form the Greater Phoenix Metropolitan Area .
#Text=Currently exurbs such as Apache Junction , Fountain Hills , Queen Creek , and Sun City are becoming part of this metropolitan area as well .
#Text=Phoenix is extremely hot and dry in the summertime , so always have sunscreen with you !
#Text=Understand
#Text=Why would anybody want to start a city in the middle of a desert ?
#Text=The answer is , surprisingly , agriculture .
#Text=The Salt and Verde Rivers of central Arizona were exploited for large - scale agriculture by Native Americans as early as the 11th century .

#Text=The area that now encompasses Phoenix was a center of the Hohokam culture , which built large canal systems and a network of towns and villages , whose remains may be viewed in the city to this day .
#Text=White settlers discovered the remnants of the Hohokam culture in the 19th century .
#Text=The city 's name reflects its history as a city " reborn from the ashes " of the previous settlement .

column1: #Text=European - American settlement of the area commenced in the 1860s , and in 1911 the completion of the first of several large reservoirs in the mountains north and east of Phoenix insured its success as a center for irrigation - based agriculture .
#Text=Many tens of thousands of acres were planted in citrus and cotton and other crops , and for many years , intensive , year - round irrigated agriculture formed the basis of the economy .
#Text=Recent years are seeing a revival , and trendy hotels , bars , shops and restaurants are making it a place to be again .
#Text=Warm and sunny winter weather also ensured a thriving tourism industry , and encouraged many Easterners and Midwesterners to relocate to Phoenix .
#Text=High - tech industry began to flourish after World War II , and since that time the growth of Phoenix has been explosive .
#Text=As a result , a population of just over 100,000 in 1950 has given way to a 2014 estimate of 1,537,058 ( with the metro area estimated at 4,489,109 ) .
#Text=Climate
#Text=Phoenix has an arid climate with long , hot summers and very mild winters .
#Text=It has the highest average temperature of any metropolitan area in the States .
#Text=The weather varies enormously from one season to the next .
#Text=While it 's not as cold as in the northern states during the winter , it does freeze sometimes , and temperatures in the 30s ° F ( that 's around or slightly above 0 ° C ) are not unheard of .
#Text=In the summer , very hot and dry heat is the norm .
#Text=On the hottest days , it can get up to 115 ° F ( 46 ° C ) or more .
#Text=Monsoon rains with lightning occur regularly from July to September during the late afternoon and evening , occasionally overnight also .
#Text=April is the most ideal month .
#Text=In some neighborhoods , cicada insects make loud sounds from sunset to sunrise .
#Text=Talk
#Text=English is the dominant language in Phoenix .
#Text=However , like much of the Southwest with a large Hispanic population , Spanish is very widely spoken in Phoenix .
#Text=Spanish is a language often used for day - to - day discourse in many places , although English is the language of preference , especially when dealing with businesses and government .
#Text=Get in
#Text=By plane
#Text=Wikimedia Maps
#Text=Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport ( IATA : PHX ) +1602275-4958 is the main air gateway to Arizona .
#Text=It is at the southeast end of Downtown .
#Text=It is a hub for American Airlines and Southwest Airlines .
#Text=Terminals are numbered from 2 - 4 .
#Text=There is no Terminal 1 .
#Text=Terminal 2 : Alaska ( Gates 10 & 11 ) , Great Lakes ( Gates C & D ) , Spirit , Sun Country , United
#Text=Terminal 3 : Delta , Frontier , Hawaiian , JetBlue
#Text=Terminal 4 : Aeroméxico , Air Canada , American , British Airways , Southwest , Volaris , WestJet
#Text=Valley Metro #13 goes west to S 75th Ave along S Buckeye ( via Greyhound depot ) from Terminal 2 .

#Text=Likewise one can take the PHX skytrain over to the nearby 44th & Washington St Station to catch the #1 ( west to the downtown Central Station and Priest & Washington in Tempe to the east along Washington St ) ; #44 bus ( north to the Desert Ridge Marriott Resort in Deer Valley along N 44th St & Tatum ) ; and the light rail ( east to Tempe & Mesa and to Midtown ( along Central Ave ) via downtown in the other direction ) .
